Title.evidence: Surgical Treatment for Ischemic Heart Failure (STICH) Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter international trial randomized patients

Participants.evidence: patients with heart failure, left ventricular ejection fraction â‰¤0.35, and coronary artery disease

Intervention.evidence: CABG with or without surgical ventricular reconstruction (SVR) compared to medical therapy (MED) alone

Objective.evidence: The STICH trial evaluates the effectiveness of coronary artery bypass graft surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were long-term survival and survival free of cardiac hospitalization, measured over a follow-up period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the interventions.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 2,136 participants were randomized: 1,067 to CABG with or without SVR and 1,069 to MED alone.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CABG with intensive MED showed improved long-term survival compared to MED alone (hazard ratio = 0.86, 95% CI 0.75 to 0.98; p = 0.03).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar across groups.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial is registered under NCT00023595
